info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 25 at 3:29PM EDT until July 25 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Catawba County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Western Lincoln County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... North central Cleveland County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Southeastern Burke County in western North Carolina... * Until 415 PM EDT. * At 329 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Morganton, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Hickory, Morganton, St. Stephens, Longview, Valdese, Icard, Drexel, Hildebran, Connelly Springs and Rutherford College. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
